title: Eva Chadwick, Hungarian wife of the sculptor Lynn Chadwick who late in life became a Jungian analyst – obituary
text:
Eva Chadwick, who has died aged 85, was known for her astute management of the estate of her late husband, the celebrated sculptor Lynn Chadwick (1914-2003), whose saleroom prices she saw rise to a record $3.5 million in 2018.

Her own story was riveting. Born in Paris on February 12 1934, she was taken to Budapest; fled in 1948; was sent to England; hoped to study law; met and married Chadwick; became the chatelaine of his Gloucestershire country house Lypiatt Park; and qualified as a Jungian analyst in 2004.

Given the French name Yvonne by her parents, she never discovered why they had been living in Paris, and was always called by her Hungarian name, Éva. They took her back to Budapest as an...
